sentences: Matthew Sherrod (born 11 July 1968) is an American drummer, musician, and a former member of the band Crowded House.
In 2007, following the 2005 death of Crowded House's drummer, Paul Hester, Sherrod was selected as a member of the band's reunion.
Matthew Jackson "Matt" Sherrod, born July 11, 1968, was brought up in Southern California.
In early 2007, following the death of their original drummer Paul Hester, Neil Finn decided to reform rock group Crowded House.
The band returned to the studio in 2008 to begin recording a full album incorporating the new lineup.
This album became Intriguer, and was released on June 11, 2010.
Sherrod played with the band full time through 2011, appearing for four last shows in 2016.

In 2007, following the 2005 death of Crowded House's drummer, Paul Hester, Sherrod was selected as a member of the band's reunion.
Having been interested in music from a young age, he began playing the drums when he was 9 years old and piano when he was 12 years old.
"Sherrod plays drums on the album Time on Earth on four tracks, including lead single "Don't Stop Now".
Sherrod is the drummer on the 1991 release of the Atlanta funk rock quint Follow for Now.
Matt and Paul Sherrod are also credited with producing the Follow for Now CD with the exception of the one song that Matt did not play on.
